001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException;
006import java.util.List;
007import java.util.Optional;
008import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
009import java.util.function.Predicate;
010
011import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder;
012import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider;
013import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider.ProviderContext;
014import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesLoaderFinder.LoaderContext;
015import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.Variables.Parameters;
016
017/**
018 * A service provider interface (SPI) for extending ezkv's capabilities to support
019 * additional media types and URI patterns. Implementations of this interface can be
020 * loaded using {@link java.util.ServiceLoader}.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * This SPI allows customization and extension of ezkv's loading mechanisms and media type
024 * parsing.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Note: This interface is sealed, and any sub-interface implementations must be
028 * registered using {@code provides KeyValuesServiceProvider with ...} in the
029 * {@code module-info.java} or as entries in the
030 * {@code META-INF/services/io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider} file.
031 * Sub-interfaces such as {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} and {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder}
032 * should <strong>not</strong> be directly referenced in the service registration.
033 *
034 * <p>
035 * Example use cases include adding support for custom media types or integrating
036 * specialized URI loading logic.
037 */
038public sealed interface KeyValuesServiceProvider {
039
040        /**
041         * Since the service providers follow a "resolver" or "finder" pattern order of the
042         * providers matters.
043         * <p>
044         * Higher values are interpreted as lower priority. As a consequence, the provider
045         * with the lowest value has the highest priority (analogous to Spring's Ordered
046         * interface).
047         * </p>
048         * Canonically the builtin components start at {@value #BUILTIN_ORDER_START} so if one
049         * is looking to override they should use a lower value.
050         * @return by default {@code 0}
051         * @see #BUILTIN_ORDER_START
052         */
053        default int order() {
054                return 0;
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * The start order of the builtin components. The start order is low enough that all
059         * the builtin components will be less than {@code 0} on purpose to avoid accidental
060         * override.
061         */
062        public static int BUILTIN_ORDER_START = -127;
063
064        /**
065         * This service provider is for other modules in your application to provide a
066         * reference configuration to be overriden and can be loaded using the
067         * {@value KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_PROVIDER} URI scheme. This is akin to
068         * <a href="https://github.com/lightbend/config?tab=readme-ov-file#standard-behavior">
069         * Lightbend/Typesafe Config <code>reference.conf</code></a> but without a resource
070         * call for maximum portability with things like GraalVM native, Maven shade plugin,
071         * and modular applications where the config could be an enscapulated resource
072         * (properties file) which would require the module to do the loading and not EZKV.
073         * <p>
074         * If one would like to load configuration from say properties file the implementation
075         * will have to do that on its own but is free to use the out of box
076         * {@link KeyValuesMedia} to parse things like properties files.
077         * <p>
078         * If using a Java modules it is recommended that the lower modules that are
079         * contributing config use <code>requires static</code> to the EZKV module to avoid
080         * unnecessary coupling if all they are doing is just providing reference config.
081         * <p>
082         * <strong>NOTE:</strong> It is recommend to avoid making key values that need
083         * interpolation from external variables as the variables may not be present. However
084         * interpolation based on the local keys being added is fine and encouraged (for
085         * example constructing a JDBC URL from a default port that is also provided). The
086         * idea again is that this reference config that needs to be guaranteed to be there
087         * for defaults and possibly participate in downstream variable/interpolation usage.
088         * <strong> It is highly recommended that you do not initialize other parts of the
089         * module that would initialize logging or something that needs configuration!
090         * </strong> If you need to use logging use the EZKV logging:
091         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getLogger()} which will by default not initialize a
092         * logging framework.
093         *
094         * <strong>Example</strong>
095         * {@snippet :
096         * public class DatabaseConfigProvider implements KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider {
097         *
098         *      public void provide(KeyValues.Builder builder, LoaderContext context) {
099         *              builder.add("database.host", "localhost");
100         *              builder.add("database.port", "5245");
101         *              builder.add("database.schema", "mydb");
102         *              builder.add("database.url", "jdbc:postgresql://${database.host}/${database.port}/${database.schema}");
103         *      }
104         *
105         * }
106         * }
107         *
108         * Down stream <code>database.port</code> could be overriden.
109         * <p>
110         * Another common usage is some module has an {@link Enum} of configuration options.
111         * This extension point allows you to fill configuration programmatically so you can
112         * loop through the enum instances and add the default properties.
113         *
114         * {@snippet :
115         * public class ContextPathProvider implements KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider {
116         *      public enum ContextPath { // for example purposes this an inner class
117         *              ACCOUNT("/account"), PROFILE("/profile");
118         *
119         *              final String path;
120         *
121         *              ContextPath(String path) {
122         *                      this.path = path;
123         *              }
124         *      }
125         *
126         *      public void provide(KeyValues.Builder builder, LoaderContext context) {
127         *              for (ContextPath p : ContextPath.values()) {
128         *                      builder.add("contextpath." + p.name().toLowerCase(), p.path);
129         *              }
130         *      }
131         * }
132         * }
133         *
134         * Note that providers can make {@link KeyValuesResource#KEY_LOAD} keys to load other
135         * resources if they really would like to have resources loaded.
136         *
137         * @see KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_PROVIDER
138         */
139        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesProvider extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
140
141                /**
142                 * A context provided to {@link KeyValuesProvider} implementations to supply
143                 * necessary dependencies and services.
144                 */
145                public sealed interface ProviderContext extends Context {
146
147                }
148
149                /**
150                 * Implementations should use the mutable builder to add key values. The provided
151                 * builder will already be preconfigured based on the {@link #name()} and other
152                 * resource meta data.
153                 * <p>
154                 * <strong> It is highly recommended that you do not initialize to many things in
155                 * this call that would initialize logging or something that needs configuration!
156                 * </strong>
157                 * <p>
158                 * If you need to use logging use the EZKV logging:
159                 * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getLogger()} which will by default not initialize a
160                 * logging framework.
161                 * @param context current load context should be used mainly to use
162                 * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getLogger()} and to help parse literal strings that
163                 * are properties.
164                 * @param builder used to add key values.
165                 */
166                void provide(ProviderContext context, KeyValues.Builder builder);
167
168                /**
169                 * The name used to identify where the key values are coming from. The name should
170                 * follow {@value KeyValuesResource#RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX} regex and because by
171                 * default the {@link Class#getSimpleName()} is used this method should be
172                 * implemented if your class does not follow that naming regex.
173                 * @return by default {@link Class#getSimpleName()}.
174                 */
175                default String name() {
176                        return this.getClass().getSimpleName();
177                }
178
179        }
180
181        /**
182         * A service provider interface for finding {@link KeyValuesLoader} implementations
183         * that can handle specific {@link KeyValuesResource} instances.
184         */
185        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesLoaderFinder extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
186
187                /**
188                 * A context provided to {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} implementations to supply
189                 * necessary dependencies and services for creating a {@link KeyValuesLoader}.
190                 */
191                public sealed interface LoaderContext extends Context {
192
193                }
194
195                /**
196                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesLoader} capable of loading the specified
197                 * {@link KeyValuesResource} using the provided {@link LoaderContext}. <strong>If
198                 * the resource cannot be found the returned {@link KeyValuesLoader} should throw
199                 * a {@link FileNotFoundException} or {@link NoSuchFileException} to indicate not
200                 * found and not Optional.empty which conversely means no matching loader could be
201                 * found based on the resource. </strong>
202                 * @param context the context containing dependencies and services
203                 * @param resource the resource for which a loader is sought
204                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the loader if found, or empty if not
205                 * @see KeyValuesLoader#load()
206                 */
207                public Optional<? extends KeyValuesLoader> findLoader(LoaderContext context, KeyValuesResource resource);
208
209        }
210
211        /**
212         * A service provider interface (SPI) for filtering key values after a resource is
213         * loaded.
214         *
215         * <p>
216         * Filters are applied to modify, rename, or remove key-value pairs without altering
217         * the original resource. This can be useful for transforming keys to a desired format
218         * or eliminating unnecessary entries before the key values are processed further.
219         *
220         * <h2>Usage</h2>
221         * <p>
222         * A {@code KeyValuesFilter} is invoked after a {@link KeyValuesResource} is loaded
223         * but before the resulting {@link KeyValues} are passed to the next stage of
224         * processing. The filter uses a filter name and optional parameters to determine how
225         * the key values should be modified.
226         * </p>
227         *
228         * Filters are enabled by using the {@link KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILTER} key where the
229         * default syntax is <code>_filter_[resourceName]_[filterId]=expression</code>.
230         *
231         * <h2>Builtin Filters</h2>
232         *
233         * <h3><code>grep</code></h3>
234         *
235         * Grep will filter keys by a regular expression. If the expression matches any part
236         * of the key the key value is included.
237         *
238         * {@snippet lang = properties :
239         *
240         * _load_resource=...
241         * _filter_resource_grep=someregex
242         *
243         * }
244         *
245         * <h3><code>sed</code></h3>
246         *
247         * Sed can change the keys name with subsitution or drop keys altogether. It follows a
248         * subset of the UNIX sed command where "<code>s</code>" and "<code>d</code>" are
249         * supported commands.
250         *
251         * {@snippet lang = properties :
252         *
253         * _load_resource=...
254         * _filter_resource_sed=/match/ s/replace/withme/g
255         *
256         * }
257         *
258         * <h2>Extensibility</h2>
259         * <p>
260         * Implementations of {@code KeyValuesFilter} can be registered using the
261         * {@code provides} directive in {@code module-info.java} or the
262         * {@code META-INF/services} mechanism with the fully qualified name of
263         * {@link KeyValuesServiceProvider}. <strong>Ideally the filter only applies filtering
264         * based on the passed in filter name.</strong> Otherwise it should just return the
265         * passed in key values.
266         * </p>
267         *
268         * <p>
269         * For example, to provide a custom implementation:
270         * </p>
271         * <pre>{@code
272         * module my.module {
273         *     provides io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider with my.module.MyKeyValuesFilter;
274         * }
275         * }</pre>
276         *
277         * <h2>Method Details</h2>
278         *
279         * <p>
280         * The {@link #filter(FilterContext, KeyValues, Filter)} method performs the filtering
281         * operation.
282         * </p>
283         */
284        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesFilter extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
285
286                // TODO maybe the filter context should have the currently loaded key values so
287                // far
288
289                /**
290                 * Provides contextual information to a filter, including the environment and any
291                 * parameters specified for the filtering operation.
292                 *
293                 * @param environment the environment used to access system-level properties and
294                 * resources
295                 * @param parameters resource parameters that come from
296                 * {@link KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARAM} keys.
297                 * @param keyValueIgnore keys that should be ignored and not filtered if the
298                 * predicate returns <code>true</code>.
299                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_FILTER_RESOURCE_KEYS
300                 */
301                public record FilterContext(KeyValuesEnvironment environment, Parameters parameters,
302                                Predicate<KeyValue> keyValueIgnore) {
303                }
304
305                /**
306                 * A filter description with filter identifier and expression which is the DSL
307                 * code that the filter will parse use to do filtering.
308                 *
309                 * @param filter filter identifier.
310                 * @param expression string code used by the filter to determine filtering.
311                 * @param name used to differentiate multiple calls to the same filter type when
312                 * looking up parameters. Defaults to empty string.
313                 */
314                public record Filter(String filter, String expression, String name) {
315
316                }
317
318                /**
319                 * Applies a filter to the given key-value pairs. The filter should ideally only
320                 * be applied if the passed filter parameter matches (filter name) otherwise the
321                 * filter should return {@link Optional#empty()} which indicates the filter did
322                 * not match or was not applicable. Note that if the filter is applicable but
323                 * wants to return an empty key values it should return an Optional of empty key
324                 * values and not {@link Optional#empty()}.
325                 * @param context the filter context providing the environment and parameters
326                 * @param keyValues the key-value pairs loaded by the current resource to be
327                 * filtered
328                 * @param filter filter description
329                 * @return an optional {@link KeyValues} instance with the filtered key-value
330                 * pairs
331                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException or subclass if the filter expression is
332                 * malformed.
333                 * @throws KeyValuesException if some other key value parsing like error happens.
334                 */
335                Optional<KeyValues> filter(FilterContext context, KeyValues keyValues, Filter filter)
336                                throws IllegalArgumentException, KeyValuesException;
337
338        }
339
340        /**
341         * A service provider interface for finding {@link KeyValuesMedia} implementations
342         * based on various attributes such as file extensions, media types, and URIs.
343         */
344        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesMediaFinder extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
345
346                /**
347                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on the attributes of a given
348                 * {@link KeyValuesResource}.
349                 * @param resource the resource for which to find the media type
350                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
351                 */
352                default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByResource(KeyValuesResource resource) {
353                        String mediaType = resource.mediaType();
354                        if (mediaType == null) {
355                                return findByUri(resource.uri());
356                        }
357                        return findByMediaType(mediaType);
358                }
359
360                /**
361                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a file extension.
362                 * @param ext the file extension (e.g., "properties")
363                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
364                 */
365                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByExt(String ext);
366
367                /**
368                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a media type string.
369                 * @param mediaType the media type (e.g., "application/json")
370                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
371                 */
372                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByMediaType(String mediaType);
373
374                /**
375                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a {@link URI}.
376                 * @param uri the URI to analyze
377                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
378                 */
379                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByUri(URI uri);
380
381        }
382
383}
384
385/**
386 * A context provided to {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} implementations to supply necessary
387 * dependencies and services for creating a {@link KeyValuesLoader}.
388 */
389sealed interface Context {
390
391        /**
392         * Retrieves the {@link KeyValuesEnvironment} for accessing system-level resources and
393         * properties.
394         * @return the environment instance
395         */
396        KeyValuesEnvironment environment();
397
398        /**
399         * Retrieves the {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder} for finding media types.
400         * @return the media finder instance
401         */
402        KeyValuesMediaFinder mediaFinder();
403
404        /**
405         * Retrieves the {@link Variables} used for interpolation.
406         * @return the variables instance
407         */
408        Variables variables();
409
410        /**
411         * Finds and returns a required parser for the specified {@link KeyValuesResource}.
412         * Throws an exception if no parser is found.
413         * @param resource the resource for which to find a parser
414         * @return the parser for the resource
415         * @throws KeyValuesMediaException if no parser is found for the resource's media type
416         */
417        default KeyValuesMedia.Parser requireParser(KeyValuesResource resource) throws KeyValuesMediaException {
418                var media = mediaFinder() //
419                        .findByResource(resource) //
420                        .orElseThrow(() -> new KeyValuesMediaException("Media Type not found. resource: " + resource));
421                return new SafeParser(media.parser(resource.parameters()), media.getMediaType());
422        }
423
424        /**
425         * Formats a {@link KeyValuesResource} into its key-value representation and applies
426         * it to a given consumer. This method allows serializing the resource into key-value
427         * pairs.
428         * @param resource the resource to format
429         * @param consumer the consumer to apply the formatted key-value pairs
430         */
431        void formatResource(KeyValuesResource resource, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer);
432
433        /**
434         * Formats a resource parameter key how it is represented as key in the parsed
435         * resource.
436         * @param resource resource to base the full parameter name on.
437         * @param parameterName the short parameter from
438         * {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()}.
439         * @return FQ parameter name.
440         */
441        String formatParameterKey(KeyValuesResource resource, String parameterName);
442
443}
444
445record DefaultLoaderContext(KeyValuesEnvironment environment, KeyValuesMediaFinder mediaFinder, Variables variables,
446                KeyValuesResourceParser resourceParser,
447                List<? extends KeyValuesProvider> providers) implements LoaderContext, ProviderContext {
448        static LoaderContext of(KeyValuesSystem system, Variables variables, KeyValuesResourceParser resourceParser) {
449                List<? extends KeyValuesProvider> providers = switch (system) {
450                        case DefaultKeyValuesSystem d -> d.providers();
451                };
452                return new DefaultLoaderContext(system.environment(), system.mediaFinder(), variables, resourceParser,
453                                providers);
454        }
455
456        @Override
457        public void formatResource(KeyValuesResource resource, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
458                resourceParser.formatResource(resource, consumer);
459        }
460
461        @Override
462        public String formatParameterKey(KeyValuesResource resource, String parameterName) {
463                return resourceParser.formatParameterKey(resource, parameterName);
464        }
465
466}
